results.title: Priory, the only home I've got
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Anne Wheeler, Michael Scott and Mark Dolgoy
results.brief_description: The Priory is a public extended care hospital in Victoria, B.C. for people suffering from chronic geriatric illnesses. Treatment is innovative. It is based on the theory that even the ordinary activities of a patient’s life contain elements of therapy. The film shows us how patients are encouraged to do as much as they can for themselves despite their confinement to wheelchairs. The hospital at the time of the film’s release, was considered to be a leader in the field of extended care. The film won awards in Toronto and New York.

results.title: Prior and present experience (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Kismet Films and Robert E. Gilbert
results.brief_description: Uses a field trip to point out the need for careful consideration by the teacher of the often unnoticed differences between backgrounds of both students and teachers. Explains that teachers must co-ordinate and supplement both home and school experiences of students.

results.title: Prints
results.brief_description: Presents a number of simple printmaking processes, including found-object, vegetable and roller printing, string and cardboard printing and crayon graffito. Opens up a wide range of possibilities for individual exploration and experimentation. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Printmaking: four artists, four media
results.brief_description: Printmaking can be divided into four basic methods: serigraph, or silk-screen; woodcut; lithograph; and intaglio, which includes dry-point, mezzotint, engraving, etching and aquatint. In the workshops of four printmakers we see how each method progresses from sketch to finished print, including the special equipment and skills required by each method. Differences in production and the finished artwork are contrasted.

results.title: Printmakers
results.brief_description: Shows five outstanding American graphic artists - Warden Day, Karl Schrag, Seong Moy, Gabor Peterdi, and Mauricio Losavsky - at work in their respective studios. Describes the technical skills of each in his individual approach to the art of printmaking.

results.title: Printing presses and engineering: one of our own kind
results.creator_credit: Vickers Films, Leslie Sansom, John Edwards and Peter Baylis
results.brief_description: Documentary on printing in Yorkshire, Town of Otley, iron casting and printing press made in the 1880s and mass produced in Leeds for distribution overseas. Printing from paper to bottle caps and uptodate methods. Narrated by Anthony Quayle.

results.title: Printer light play
results.brief_description: A study on the technical properties of film colour. Shot on Eastman colour negative, the film records a variety of combinations of the printer lights, blue, red and green, thus creating different colour effects with the subject, a boy holding a Kodak colour control card.

results.title: Principles of X-Rays
results.brief_description: In an age of historical introduction the work of Rontgen, von Laue and Bragg is recalled to explain the nature of X-rays. The generations of X-rays is considered; application of the quantum theory showing the composition of the “White” X-ray spectrum; deals with line spectra, X-ray crystallography, illustrates the measurement of X-ray and of inter-atomic distances and summarizes he applications of X-rays for research.

results.title: Principles of ultrasonics
results.creator_credit: Data Film Productions and Jack Chambers
results.brief_description: Indicates the relation and range of sonic and ultrasonic waves. Also shows how ultrasonic waves are detected and the various types of wave generator used to propagate them; their properties and the uses to which they can be put.
results.description: Indicates the relation and range of sonic and ultrasonic waves. Also shows how ultrasonic waves are detected and the various types of wave generator used to propagate them; their properties and the uses to which they can be put.
